Module com.example.breakout_clone
Package com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite

Class BrickModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite.SpriteModel
com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite.BrickModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Breakable, Impactable
public class BrickModel extends SpriteModel implements Breakable, Impactable
Model class for the Brick MVC. It stores all the data of a Brick object and provides the controller with functions to allow it to modify the state/data of the model
This class contains the brick logic for the game, i.e. what to do when the brick is broken, what to do when the ball collides with the brick, etc.
The class implements the Breakable and the Impactable interface and all its method
Author:
Praket Chavan
See Also:
SpriteModel, Breakable, Impactable

    • findImpact

      public int findImpact​(Impactable parent)
      Find the impact between the current object and the passed impactable object Finds impacts between the ball and the brick and calls the onImpact(int) method with the correct constant value
      Specified by:
      findImpact in interface Impactable
      Parameters:
      parent - the ball object as an Impactable object
      Returns:
      the side on which the collision has occurred

    • checkBroken

      public boolean checkBroken()
      This method checks whether the sprite is broken Checks the strength property to see if the brick is broken
      Specified by:
      checkBroken in interface Breakable
      Returns:
      true if the strength is less than 0 else false

    • onBreak

      public int onBreak()
      This method provides steps to take once a sprite is broken Checks to see if the brick is special. If it is, then it has a chance to generate a new PowerUp
      Specified by:
      onBreak in interface Breakable
      Returns:
      a constant defined int that signifies whether the broken brick is special or not
